metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3736 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
BIND 9 resolver can crash when stale cache and stale answers are enabled, option `stale-answer-client-timeout` is set to a positive integer, and the resolver receives an RRSIG query. This issue affects BIND 9 versions 9.16.12 through 9.16.36, 9.18.0 through 9.18.10, 9.19.0 through 9.19.8, and 9.16.12-S1 through 9.16.36-S1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3736` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.11
bind9-dnsutils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.11
bind9-host - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.11
bind9-libs - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.11
bind9-utils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.11
bind9utils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.11
dnsutils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.11
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> As of isc-dhcp-4.4.3-1, isc-dhcp vendors bind9 libs mdeslaur> This issue was introduced in 9.16.12

criterions.comment: bind9 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.11').
